item.title: Taiko Sound
item.description: The sound of the Taiko brings many people to it. Here’s a mini-session I taught Jiten Daiko on how I think about the sounds coming from Taiko. Hopefully I can prove these things that I have empircally found using some modeling (Bessel functions and waves on a boundary!) but we’ll see if I find the time. Breaking down the Sound Thinking about the shape of a waveform and given the fact that we use the same instruments/bachi, I believe we can really only control the attack, the tail, and the chorus.

item.title: Soloing Tips
item.description: Here are a few tips and tricks to help you solo in Taiko. Johakyuu: Johakyuu is a Japanese music and art aesthetic. It is about using the structure of: Soundscape, set tempo, climax, volta, rapid conclusion to guide a complete story. Repetition Repeat the same motif eight times with slight variations so there is a continuation but also variety. Don’t move onto other things too fast and not communicate your ideas.
